title: Entity header
summary: An entity header is an HTTP header that describes the payload of an HTTP message (i.e. metadata about the message body). Entity headers include: Content-Length, Content-Language, Content-Encoding, Content-Type, Expires, etc. Entity headers may be present in both HTTP request and response messages.
